resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

   https://www.boost.org/users/news/boost_has_moved_downloads_to_jfr.html

kou commented on a change in pull request #11275:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11275#discussion_r718886218



##########
File path: cpp/cmake_modules/ThirdpartyToolchain.cmake
##########
@@ -402,7 +402,7 @@ else()
            # ${ARROW_BOOST_BUILD_VERSION_UNDERSCORES}
            "https://github.com/ursa-labs/thirdparty/releases/download/latest/boost_${ARROW_BOOST_BUILD_VERSION_UNDERSCORES}.tar.gz"
            "https://sourceforge.net/projects/boost/files/boost/${ARROW_BOOST_BUILD_VERSION}/boost_${ARROW_BOOST_BUILD_VERSION_UNDERSCORES}.tar.gz"
-           "https://github.com/boostorg/boost/archive/boost-${ARROW_BOOST_BUILD_VERSION}.tar.gz"
+           "https://boostorg.jfrog.io/artifactory/main/release/${ARROW_BOOST_BUILD_VERSION}/source/boost_${ARROW_BOOST_BUILD_VERSION_UNDERSCORES}.tar.gz"

Review comment:
       How about prioritizing boostorg.jfrog.org over sourceforge.net?




--

bkmgit commented on pull request #11275:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11275#issuecomment-933319324


   Related to https://issues.apache.org/jira/projects/ARROW/issues/ARROW-6407
   - Maybe alternate URLs also needed in https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/cpp/thirdparty/versions.txt ?
   - Trimmed Boost could also be uploaded to a different location? 
   - [FetchContent](https://cmake.org/cmake/help/latest/module/FetchContent.html) will need CMake 3.11 or 3.14 as minimum rather than 3.5.
   -  [FileDownload](https://cmake.org/cmake/help/latest/command/file.html#transfer) can be used with if statements, for example as done in [CMake tests](https://gitlab.kitware.com/cmake/cmake/-/blob/master/Tests/CMakeTests/FileDownloadTest.cmake.in) and also described on [StackOverflow 6125573](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/61255773/cmake-file-download-ignores-errors), though this might require higher maintenance burden


-- 
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

nealrichardson commented on pull request #11275:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11275#issuecomment-933764906


   I think boost is the only one we trim, all of the other backup URLs should have the same hashes. The quickest fix might be to remove the checksum for boost. 


--

kou commented on pull request #11275:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11275#issuecomment-935650547


   It seems that ARROW-6407 isn't a good place to discuss this. It's more generic. We just want to remove checksum only for Boost as a workaround for now.
   
   The real fix may use ARROW-6407. (We may use `file(DOWNLOAD)` https://cmake.org/cmake/help/latest/command/file.html#download for checking trimmed Boost availability and choose suitable download URLs and checksum. We will use trimmed Boost's URL and checksum when it's available. Otherwise, normal boost download URLs and checksum.)


--

   (Or we may use `FileContent` https://cmake.org/cmake/help/latest/module/FetchContent.html .)


--

bkmgit commented on pull request #11275:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11275#issuecomment-939978578


   This requires a recent version of CMake, 3.11 (released 2018 December 1) or 3.14 (released 2019 March 14), so `dile(DOWNLOAD)` seems better.  [ParaView superbuild](https://gitlab.kitware.com/paraview/paraview-superbuild/-/tree/master/) has an option to download all dependencies first, and then build, so maybe can update the download script to try different locations successively.


--

fields.description: Boost downloads available on Jfrog. Need to update location.

comments.body:
Maybe also remove the GitHub URL
"https://github.com/boostorg/boost/archive/boost-${ARROW_BOOST_BUILD_VERSION}.tar.gz"
